lead_paragraph: A local branch of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the blast in the southern city of Aden, one of the deadliest since Yemen’s civil war began.

byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.
byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

headline.print_headline: Suicide Bomber Kills Army Recruits in South Yemen
headline.main: Suicide Bomber Kills Dozens of Yemeni Army Recruits

snippet: A local branch of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the blast in the southern city of Aden, one of the deadliest since Yemen’s civil war began.
abstract: Suicide bomber attacks Yemeni army recruits in Aden, killing dozens of people in what is being described as one of deadliest bombings in city since start of civil war; local branch of Islamic State claims responsibility.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
